main_definition: To bring something back to its original or former condition, often after it has been damaged or worn out.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reinstate an old style or appearance
meanings_and_examples.example: After the renovation, they restored the classic look of the building.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Repair something damaged and return it to its original state
meanings_and_examples.example: The antique clock was broken but after hours of work, the restorer managed to restore it to its former glory.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To revive or recreate a lost feature in culture, art, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: They worked on restoring the ancient painting that had been thought to be lost forever.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Make something available again after it has ceased
meanings_and_examples.example: The city council took steps to restore public transportation services which were previously suspended due to budget cuts.
